metadata.Name: Dangerous Speech Dataset
metadata.Description: A dataset of 2,972 documents from a white supremacist forum (Stormfront) and a satirical wiki (Encyclopedia Dramatica). The documents are labeled for containing 'dangerous speech', defined as speech that can increase the risk of violence against a group of people.
metadata.Paper Title: Understanding and Detecting Dangerous Speech in Social Media
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2012 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies
metadata.Venue Name: Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies
metadata.Abstract: We define the new category of 'dangerous speech' (DS), language that can increase the risk of violence by a group against another group. We create a lexicon of dangerous speech terms from a variety of sources and use it to create a new dataset of 2,972 documents from a white supremacist forum and a mainstream news source, which we label for DS. We find that our lexicon is a good indicator of DS, and that we can classify documents for DS with an accuracy of .78 using lexicon features. We make our lexicon and dataset freely available.
